Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure

package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure
Various utility classes for handling any of the color spaces, which are in subpackages of this one. FloatColors has methods that work with almost any color space, Interpolation is mostly copied from libGDX and provides code to adjust the curve of interpolations, and MathTools includes code from both libGDX's MathUtils class and the trigonometric approximations these classes often use.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.cielab
    CIELAB, the 1976 CIE L*A*B* color space.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.hsluv
    HSLuv, a type of Hue, Saturation, Lightness color space with more even lightness.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.ipt
    Color space code specialized for IPT.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.ipt_hq
    Color space code specialized for IPT, Higher Quality version.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.oklab
    Oklab, the Okay-enough LAB color space.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.rgb
    Color space code specialized for RGB.
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.ycwcm
    Color space code specialized for YCwCm, a custom YCC color space.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    FloatColors
    Various utility methods for working with colors encoded as packed floats in any of the formats this can use.
    Interpolation
    Takes a linear value in the range of 0-1 and outputs a (usually) non-linear, interpolated value.
    Interpolation.BiasGain
    A wrapper around MathTools.barronSpline(float, float, float) to use it as an Interpolation.

    Interpolation.SwingIn
     
    Interpolation.SwingOut
     
    MathTools
    Some alternative approximations to sin(), cos(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2(), including the option to measure most values in turns instead of radians (where 1 turn equals 2pi radians).
